channel.title: The Gaslight Podcast
channel.description: Gaslighters discuss development, technology businesses, and software culture.
channel.itunes:author: Mich Lloyd
channel.itunes:subtitle: Gaslighters discuss development, technology businesses, and software culture.
channel.itunes:summary: Gaslighters discuss development, technology businesses, and software culture.

item.title: Gaslight Podcast #15: Software Entrepreneurship with Joe Pantuso
item.description: This episode features Joe Pantuso Cincinnati local software entrepreneur. We cover Joe's impressive career as an early employee of PKWARE the creator of a Doom game modding engine, an author of multiple books, and the successful founder of a company that was purchased by McAfee. You'll come away feeling inspired.
item.dc:creator: Mitch Lloyd

item.title: Gaslight Podcast #14: Github Culture with Chris Wanstrath
item.description:
Chris Wanstrath, co-founder of Github, joined us to talk about his company's culture. We discuss the process they use to ship products, hiring good people, and beer thirty.

"Make sure the finished version is something that exists in your mind."
item.dc:creator: Mitch Lloyd

item.title: Gaslight Podcast #13: Introducing Michael Guterl
item.description: Michael Guterl joins us to talk about his career with programming and how to pronounce his name. We dive into Michael's secrets for being an awesome programmer, talk about the balance of automated testing, and discuss how he uses Getting Things Done in his workflow.
item.dc:creator: Mitch Lloyd

item.title: Gaslight Podcast #12: Benefit Corporations
item.description: In this podcast we speak with Kelly Dolan and Michael Kroeger from Ingage about B Corporations. B Corporations are companies that measure their success by their impact on the planet, the community, and their employees as well as profits. Lean what a "triple bottom line" is and what makes these companies special.
item.dc:creator: Mitch Lloyd

item.title: Gaslight Podcast #11: The Brandery With Robert McDonald
item.description: This week we met with Robert McDonald, cofounder of The Brandery, a Cincinnati incubator. We talked about why you may want to launch a startup in Cincinnati, what it takes to succeed with an incubator, and how to get your groceries in New York City.
item.dc:creator: Mitch Lloyd

item.title: Gaslight Podcast #10: Corey Haines via CodeMash
item.description: Chris Nelson sat down with The Legend, Corey Haines at the CodeMash conference. Corey talks about what he's learned from his pair programming tour across the country. We also hear about his experience putting together a new video series called Build An App with Corey Haines.
item.dc:creator: Mitch Lloyd

item.title: Gaslight Podcast #9: Digital Doodles with Ryan Arthur
item.description:
This week we recorded the Podcast at Kevin's house with our past design intern and now newest full-time hire, Ryan Arthur. In this episode we talk about learning with digital doodles, HAML & SASS, responsive designs, the importance of user experience design over aesthetic design, and how to find a design job you'll love.

  • Ryan on Github
  • Ryan's sliding search thingy on CodePen
item.dc:creator: Mitch Lloyd

item.title: Gaslight Podcast #8: Girl Develop It
item.description: We met with Sara Chipps and Erin Kidwell to talk about Girl Develop It, an organization that holds classes and events for developers and aspiring developers. In this episode we talk about how Girl Develop It spread across the country with sold out classes in only 2 years. Also we discuss creating an inclusive atmosphere and what makes a great teacher.
item.dc:creator: Mitch Lloyd

item.title: Gaslight Podcast #7: Software Project Guidance with Doug Alcorn - Part 2
item.description: In this episode, Kevin and I continue our conversation on project guidance with Doug Alcorn. We talk about different approaches to dividing up work and the factors that make certain projects more successful than others.
item.dc:creator: Mitch Lloyd

item.title: Gaslight Podcast #6: Software Project Guidance with Doug Alcorn - Part 1
item.description:
We sat down with Doug Alcorn to talk about software project... guidance? This week we dive head on into a discussion of what it takes to have a successful software project. We had such a good time riding the rapids and turning it up to 11 that we made this a two part series.

  • Jeff Paton's Company - comakewith.us
item.dc:creator: Mitch Lloyd

item.title: Gaslight Podcast #5: Jim Weirich on Rake, Staying Sharp, and Testing
item.description: This week we spoke with Cincinnati local Jim Weirich about the new version of Rake, how he keeps learning, and the case for different kinds of testing.
item.dc:creator: Mitch Lloyd

item.title: Gaslight Podcast #4: Roadtrippers.com with James Fisher
item.description: Kevin and I had a delightful conversation with James Fisher of Roadtrippers.com. While gazing over Cincinnati's historic Over-the-Rhine neighborhood, we talked about the challenges of running a start-up and the trouble with the advice you'll receive along the way.
item.dc:creator: Mitch Lloyd

item.title: Gaslight Podcast #3: LocalizeIt with Jeremy Siefkas
item.description: This week we spoke with Jeremy Siefkas about LocalizeIt, creating a successful Internet business from scratch, and managing the direction of large software projects. You'll gain insights into the world of online advertising and learn about "Total Page Domination".
item.dc:creator: Mitch Lloyd

item.title: Gaslight Podcast #2: Consensus Decision-Making and Turbo Links with Steve Klabnik
item.description: To our delight, Steve Klabnik joins us on the second Gaslight podcast. We learned about his passion for text-based adventure games at a young age and why "people problems" are more interesting than "technical problems"; when developing software. We also discuss how organizations can effectively use consensus discussion-making for a flatter structure. Finally Steve weighs in on the merits of Turbo Links and the need for measurable facts when talking performance.
item.dc:creator: Mitch Lloyd

item.title: Gaslight Podcast #1: Client-Side Development with Chris Nelson
item.description:
In this inaugural episode of the Gaslight Podcast Kevin Rockwood and I discuss client-side development with Chris Nelson. We also talk about Mastering Backbone, Chris' class for beautiful client-side code, and get a sneak peak at his upcoming talk at RubyConf.

  • Mastering Backbone
  • RubyConf
item.dc:creator: Mitch Lloyd
